name: RunSqlCmdScriptTask
friendlyName: Run SQL Script in SQLCMD mode
description: Run a single SQL Script in SQLCMD mode passing multiple parameters via SqlCmdVariables array
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe

inputs.name: SqlCmdSciptPath
inputs.label: Path to .sql file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root to the SQL script to run.  Wildcards can be used.  Note that the repo root is held in the variable $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: Server
inputs.label: Server name or IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Server name or IP address.  Include the database instance name and port if necessary (e.g. myserver\myinstance,myport)

inputs.name: Database
inputs.label: The name of the SQL database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the database against which the script will be run

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariables
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables (name / value pairs)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SqlCmd variables which will be passed to the SQL script.  View the variables in a grid, click on “…” next to SqlCmd Variables textbox
